definition[0]: to officially arrange for someone to have something that you own after your death
example[0]: She bequeathed her collection of paintings to the National Gallery.
example[1]: His father bequeathed him a fortune.
definition[1]: to pass knowledge, customs etc to people who come after you or live after you
definition[2]: to officially arrange for someone to have money or property that you own after your death, by writing it in your WILL
example[2]: Sharp left the museum nothing, instead bequeathing his collection to a charitable foundation.
example[3]: He bequeathed his wife 514 acres of arable land.
